Description: Worn painted wooden shabti of Amenemipet (?) with a black curled lappet-wig, a modelled brown face with traced features and parallel brown hands in relief holding two red hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with black painted hieroglyphs (now virtually illegible); the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and a yoke with two pendular vessels; much of the foot has broken away.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
